definition: along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Communities across the Gulf Coast were forever changed.
sentences.chinese: 整个波斯湾沿岸地区的社区永久性改变。

sentences.english: It covered Pacific coastal areas of Iwate, Miyagi and Fukushima prefectures.
sentences.chinese: 它涵盖的岩手县，宫城县和福岛县太平洋沿岸地区。

sentences.english: An active southerly airstream is bringing rainy weather to the south China coastal areas.
sentences.chinese: 积极偏南气流带来的雨的天气华南沿岸地区。

sentences.english: Most of the selected wines come from Entre-Deux-Mers and Côtes de Bordeaux.
sentences.chinese: 所选之酒主要来自两海之间产区与波尔多河沿岸地区。

sentences.english: The plants and trees also help protect coastal areas from storm damage.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物和树木也有助于防止风暴破坏的沿岸地区。

sentences.english: … [T]he disability community constituted approximately 20 percent of the people who lived in the Gulf Coast region.
sentences.chinese: 在海湾沿岸地区中，残疾人口占将近20%。

sentences.english: On the Pacific coast, prices have slumped 20 percent.
sentences.chinese: 在太平洋沿岸地区房价已下跌了20%。
